articles.title: Justice is meant to be blind, not to hallucinate
articles.description: The judge in the Sandie Peggie tribunal is suspected of using AI. Both police and courts are befuddled by this technology: it is no laughing matter
articles.content: But such hallucinations cease to be amusing when they pollute the legal system, as a result of laziness — or worse — on the part of professional practitioners. Over the past few days there were two apparent examples, in cases of high public importanc... [5048 chars]

articles.title: 19 US States challenge Trump’s $100,000 H
articles.description: Nineteen US states have sued the Trump administration over its “unlawful” decision to impose a $100,000 fee on new H-1B visa petitions, warning that the move will worsen labour shortages in key sectors such as health care, education and technology. articles.title: NSUT holds third convocation ceremony with great splendour
articles.description:
The third convocation ceremony of Netaji Subhas University of Technology (NSUT) was held on Saturday with great splendour at Yashobhoomi, Dwarka, in the presence of the Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta and Education Minister Ashish Sood.
A Skill Centre at the East

articles.title: CJI seeks unified judicial policy, tech for courts
articles.description:
Pushing for a “unified judicial policy,” Chief Justice of India Surya Kant on Saturday said technology can help align standards and practices across courts, creating a “seamless experience” for citizens, regardless of their location.
He said high courts — due to the federal structure —
articles.content: Pushing for a “unified judicial policy,” Chief Justice of India Surya Kant on Saturday said technology can help align standards and practices across courts, creating a “seamless experience” for citizens, regardless of their location. He said high cou... [5068 chars]

articles.title: The Rs 17,000 crore airspace upgrade: 3 stocks riding India’s next infra wave
articles.description: A massive upgrade in India's airspace could reshape the aviation ecosystem, opening new opportunities across airports, engineering, and high-tech radar players as traffic and technology demands accelerate.
articles.content: The Airports Authority of India has announced a major airspace and infrastructure expansion initiative with a capex of around ₹15,000-17,000 crore, targeted for completion by 2029. Civil construction (central tower) will account for 60% of the cost, ... [11436 chars]

articles.title: US Taps Brakes on UK Trade Deal
articles.description: Citing unresolved disputes over digital regulation, food safety and market access, the U.S.-U.K. trade deal announced in May has stalled after the Trump administration paused a related technology agreement.
articles.content:
The U.S.-U.K. trade deal announced in May has stalled after the Trump administration paused a related technology agreement, citing unresolved disputes over digital regulation, food safety and market access.
Britain was the first country to reach a tr... [2602 chars]

articles.title: Dr Jitendra addresses Delhi Industry leaders, announces Govt funding support for private sector
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Dec 13 : Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Dr. Jitendra Singh today described the Rs 1 lakh crore Research, Development, and Innovation (RDI) Fund as a historic catalyst designed to empower India’s private sector to drive the next wave of R&D, IP creation, and commercialization in frontier technologies. Addressing the RDI Fund Outreach Programme in New Delhi, the Minister said the initiative represents a first-of-its-kind global model where the Government steps […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
NEW DELHI, Dec 13 : Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Dr. Jitendra Singh today described the Rs 1 lakh crore Research, Development, and Innovation (RDI) Fund as a historic catalyst designed... [2226 chars]

articles.title: JU signs MoU with NIELIT for IT education, digital empowerment
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Dec 13: The Udhampur Campus, University of Jammu & National Institute of Electronics & Information Technology (NIELIT) J&K, today formalized a significant institutional collaboration through the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for the establishment of a NIELIT-J&K Study Centre (NJKSC) at the Udhampur Campus of JU. The MoU was signed by Dr Neeraj Sharma, Registrar JU and Ashaq Hussain Dar, Director-in-Charge, NIELIT J&K. The signing ceremony was held in the presence of Prof Yash Pal […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Dec 13: The Udhampur Campus, University of Jammu & National Institute of Electronics & Information Technology (NIELIT) J&K, today formalized a significant institutional collaboration through the signing of a Memorandum ... [1902 chars]

articles.title: HTDS Millennial Awards 2025 puts spotlight on innovators and changemakers
articles.description: The awards celebrated the inspiring journeys of individuals shaping the future in fields ranging from entrepreneurship, technology, education, social impact and culture to digital influence
articles.content: The prestigious event aimed to honour millennials who have demonstrated exceptional leadership, creativity, and commitment to driving positive change through innovation and impactful ideas. The awards celebrated the inspiring journeys of individuals ... [1822 chars]

articles.title: Satish Sharma inaugurates Indoor Stadium with multi-sports facility at Khour
articles.description: JAMMU, DECEMBER 13: Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs (FCS&CA), Transport, Information Technology, Youth Services and Sports, Satish Sharma, today inaugurated the Rs 3 crore Indoor Stadium with multi-sports facility at Khour, Jammu, marking a significant milestone in strengthening the sports infrastructure in border areas of the Union Territory. Speaking on the occasion, the Minister said that the government is working earnestly towards providing modern, accessible and inclusive sports facilities to the youth. The focus is being accorded […]
articles.content: JAMMU, DECEMBER 13: Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs (FCS&CA), Transport, Information Technology, Youth Services and Sports, Satish Sharma, today inaugurated the Rs 3 crore Indoor Stadium with multi-sports facility at Khour, Jammu... [1500 chars]
